body_html:
I installed it some time ago, via conda install tensorflow-gpu, but I got a 'Permission denied' error when I tried to uninstall it, even with sudo conda uninstall.


ERROR conda.core.link:_execute(481): An error occurred while uninstalling package 'defaults::tensorflow-gpu-base-1.4.1-py36ha7e2fe3_0'.
PermissionError(13, 'Permission denied')

In parallel, tensorflow-gpu was also installed with pip3 install, which might have screwed things up.

Regarding Pytorch, It is possible that my laptop gpu just does not support Cuda 9.*, which seems to cause the "RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (48)" error

ERROR conda.core.link:_execute(481): An error occurred while uninstalling package 'defaults::tensorflow-gpu-base-1.4.1-py36ha7e2fe3_0'.
PermissionError(13, 'Permission denied')

In parallel, tensorflow-gpu was also installed with pip3 install, which might have screwed things up.
Regarding Pytorch,  It is possible that my laptop gpu just does not support Cuda 9.*, which seems to cause the "RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (48)" error
body:
I installed it some time ago,  via `conda install tensorflow-gpu`,  but I got a 'Permission denied'  error when I tried to uninstall it,  even with `sudo conda uninstall`. 

```

ERROR conda.core.link:_execute(481): An error occurred while uninstalling package 'defaults::tensorflow-gpu-base-1.4.1-py36ha7e2fe3_0'.
PermissionError(13, 'Permission denied')
```

In parallel, tensorflow-gpu was also installed with pip3 install, which might have screwed things up.

Regarding Pytorch,  It is possible that my laptop gpu just does not support Cuda 9.*, which seems to cause the "RuntimeError: cuda runtime error (48)" error
